articles.description: Jason Dunne scored 19 points with four 3-pointers and nine rebounds, J.R. Lynch scored 13 points and made four free throws in the final 16 seconds, and Hartford beat Maine 67-63 on Thursday night.
articles.headline: Lynch's free throws help Hartford down Maine 67-63

articles.description: James Scott and Nick Masterson each scored 27 points, Anthony Wilson calmly sank two free throws on his first trip to the line with 1.1 seconds on the clock and Kennesaw State defeated Florida Gulf Coast 97-93 Thursday night, ending the Eagles'...
articles.headline: Kennesaw State beats FGCU 97-93, ending 13-game win streak

articles.description: Shaquille Morris had 23 points and 13 rebounds, including a tie-breaking putback in the final two minutes, to help No. 19 Wichita State defeat Temple 93-86 on Thursday night.
articles.headline: Morris leads No. 19 Wichita State past Temple 93-86

images.caption: Zach Brown misses the triple, but Shaquille Morris is there to clean up for the lay-in and the foul.
images.name: Morris' and-1 bucket gives the Shockers the lead

articles.description: Corey Davis Jr. and Devin Davis each scored 16 points, and Houston beat No. 5 Cincinnati 67-62 on Thursday night to snap the nation's longest winning streak at 16 games.
articles.headline: Houston ends No. 5 Cincinnati's 16-game win streak, 67-62

images.caption: The student section celebrates Houston's first win over an AP top-5 team since 1996.
images.name: Houston' student section storms the court after W

articles.description: Cam Ward scored 14 points and Drew Urquhart and Everett Duncan added 13 each as Vermont defeated New Hampshire 71-58 on Thursday night for the Catamounts' 15th consecutive victory.
articles.headline: Vermont beats UNH 71-58 for 15th straight victory

articles.description: Vasa Pusica scored 17 of his 24 points in the first half and Anthony Green tied a career-high with 16 points as Northeastern held off Drexel 75-69 on Thursday night for its fourth straight win.
articles.headline: Pusica's big first half helps Huskies hold off Dragons
